title: Sex, drinking, driving: five areas where men and women are more similar than you think
text:
Helen Mirren is in the midst of publicising her new TV series – Catherine the Great – so she’s doing the rounds giving her views about being a woman (as required) and this time her thought for the day is: there’s no such thing as “binary sexuality”, we’re all both male and female or somewhere between. For example, she says, she hates talking about her feelings, or going to the doctor, and meanwhile she’s “brilliant at map reading” – all typically male attributes.

We’re not exactly gobsmacked by this news. Then again, in late 2019 we are still wrestling with what is feminine versus what is masculine, which is why “strong” and “independent” and “sexually active in her 70s” Helen Mirren is happy...
